We are looking to hire a hygienist to do Assisted Hygiene.
For those not familiar with assisted hygiene, your job is to scale and polish the patients teeth while chatting with them and making them feel comfortable and discussing OHI as well as probing when due.
The assistant who will be assigned to you will clean and setup your room, write your notes, be available for probings. Wait for the doctor exam, treatment plan and take notes with doctor exam, clean your instruments, apply fluoride, take x-ray schedule your patients.
This is hard work (it's exactly how the dentists work) but comes with higher pay as you are able to see a higher volume of patients.
We are looking for full or part time and will be happy to do a working interview if you would like to try out this process and see what you think.

We are a small family dental practice in downtown Mill Valley, looking for a Registered Dental Hygienist to join our single doctor team. We are looking for a RDH for one or for two days a week (ideally Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Wednesday.)
Our staff is fully vaccinated and our office has excellent COVID protocols in place to keep ourselves and our patients healthy--We are equipped with full PPE for all staff members, brand new state of the art HVAC system, HEPA filters running through the practice, DryShield technology for any AGP etc.
Our goal is to work together as compassionate team so we we can provide the highest level of care for our wonderful patients.
The ideal applicant would be comfortable using some digital practice management software, which we can train you to use, and taking digital dental x-rays. We use Dexis at our practice.

We are looking for a dental hygienist to join our caring and supportive team in the Phinney Ridge/Greenwood area of Seattle, WA. We are open to someone who would like to work full-time or part-time. Our most immediate need are on Mondays and Fridays. We are open Monday-Friday from 7am-4pm.
Completely digital and innovative office using Open dental software, CBCT and Dentimax xray sensors. Most dental services offered in house. Check out our 5-star reviews on Google - Phinney Ridge Dental. : )
We offer competitive compensation, paid time off, paid sick leave, medical benefits, paid holidays, access to 401k and dental benefits for full time employees. New Grads Welcome!
Please send your resume for consideration.

Who Are We?
We are Jefferson Dental & Orthodontics and we believe in taking a personal approach to dentistry. Since our humble beginnings in Texas in 1967, we’ve been a trusted friend for our patients near and far. At Jefferson, we understand it takes more than clinical excellence to earn a patient’s trust. It’s of the utmost importance that we all see the patient as a unique individual and demonstrate that their care plan is designed around each of their needs. We’ll do whatever it takes to put a smile on each patient’s face, so the rest of the world can see how amazing it is. We truly change people’s lives. Do you want to be a part of our life changing team?!
Our philosophy is simple: Our Care Changes People’s Lives. We treat our patients like family to provide the best dental experience because we know a happy, confident smile leads to a better life. We deliver the highest quality care, making dentistry convenient and affordable for everyone. Join our new Hygiene team for the opportunity to have a fulfilling career giving our patients the happy, confident smile they deserve.
The Dental Assistant works under the supervision of the Lead RDA and are responsible for a wide range of tasks in the dental office - ranging from patient care and education to administrative duties to laboratory functions. Note: All employees need to be flexible and available to provide dental assistance and perform front desk duties based on the patient needs and as directed by office management.

We are looking for a caring and motivated dental hygienist to join our team . We are looking for a hygienist that has a great attitude and can be efficient and effective. You will be responsible for providing clinical dental services and duties which include but are not limited to the following:
Perform patient screenings, review health history, take blood pressure and pulse,assess oral health conditions.
Performs patient treatment procedures, such as: debridement, scaling and root planning, prophylaxis, polishing and application of preventative material, etc.
Educate and counsel patients about appropriate oral hygiene strategies and nutritional choices to maintain good oral health..
Protecting patients and employees by adhering to infection-control policies and protocols.

We are a small established downtown Gig Harbor office that are seeking a second part time Dental Hygienist position to start immediately.
We are fully digital; and we use Eaglesoft software. Our xray system we use is phosphor plates. It's a great office to work in, with great staff - super friendly and easy going. We provide all the recommended PPE gear and we allow 10 minutes in between patients so that rooms can be fully irrigated.
Our office hours are Monday-Wednesday 8am-5pm with lunch 1-2pm. Thursdays 8am-2pm with no lunch. We give 10 minutes extra time in between patients. We do not work Fridays. The position is for 16+ hours (two working days). We are flexible with any day Monday-Thursday and hours that you choose.
Benefits (even for part time)!

Dental Hygienist Job Responsibilities:
Promotes dental health by completing dental prophylaxis, providing oral cancer screening and radiographic studies, charting conditions of decay and disease, and performing procedures in compliance with the Dental Practice Act.
Prepares treatment room for patient by adhering to prescribed procedures and protocols.
Prepares patient for dental hygiene treatment by welcoming, soothing, seating, and draping patient.
Provides information to patients and employees by answering questions and requests.
Maintains instrumentation for dental hygiene treatment by sharpening, sterilizing, and selecting instruments.

We are looking for a Dental Hygienist to help treat patients and promote good oral health practices. What do Dental Hygienists do? Dental Hygienist duties revolve around conducting initial patient screenings, cleaning teeth (e.g. removing plaque) and advising patients on oral health and preventative care. You’ll help dentists decide treatments for teeth or gum diseases and handle dental emergencies. As a Dental Hygienist, you should be reliable and able to build trust with patients of all ages. You should have deep knowledge of relevant health and safety rules and a good eye for oral diseases and anomalies. If you have a steady hand and great bedside manner, we’d like to meet you.

Ensure patients feel as comfortable as possible before their examination

Hygienist
We are a busy professional dental office with an immediate opening for a dental hygienist.
Primary Job Duties Include:
Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized
Instruct and educate patients in oral hygiene, provide preventative dental care, take x-rays, or apply fluoride or sealants

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

Job Title: Part Time/Full Time Registered Dental Hygienist posiiton
Job Description:
Part-Time/Full Time Registered Dental Hygienist position
Our well established and highly recommended Periodontal office in Cupertino is looking for a Part Time, to potential Full Time RDH. We are looking for a Dental Hygienist to help treat patients and promote good oral health practices. What do Dental Hygienists do? Dental Hygienist duties revolve around conducting initial patient screenings, cleaning teeth (e.g. removing plaque) and advising patients on oral health and preventative care. You’ll help dentists decide treatments for teeth or gum diseases and handle dental emergencies. As a Dental Hygienist, you should be reliable and able to build trust with patients of all ages. You should have deep knowledge of relevant health and safety rules and a good eye for oral diseases and anomalies. If you have a steady hand and great bedside manner, we’d like to meet you.

Hygienist
We are a busy professional dental office with an immediate opening for a dental hygienist.
Primary Job Duties Include:
Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

Hygienist
We are a busy professional dental office with an immediate opening for a dental hygienist.
Primary Job Duties Include:
Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized
Instruct and educate patients in oral hygiene, provide preventative dental care, take x-rays, or apply fluoride or sealants

All of our Hygiene treatment rooms are equipped with extra-oral suction devices, ultrasonic scalers, intra-oral cameras, and all digital x-rays. We are looking for that special dental hygienist who is in search of an office that he/she can call their home. We know the value in finding that special environment where you feel good about the way that the doctor and team treat the patients, the quality of the dental care is top notch and done with ethics, the environment is uplifting and fun and people have been there a long time and support each other. We also realize the value in working at the same location for many years. It is so rare but one of the most rewarding things that the profession has to offer. If you are career oriented and want to find a quality place that you can call home, we are looking for you and have a rare opening at this time. Renton Highlands across from QFC.

Job Type: Full-time

We are a super generalist dental office, meaning that we deliver a wide variety of services to our patients, ranging from regular maintenance to surgical and prosthetic rehabilitation of the dentition. We are a technically advanced practice, base our treatment recommendations upon the latest science, and are continually evolving, learning, and expanding our skill sets.
We are looking for a hygienist who fits this culture, exudes positivity and has a natural inclination to go the extra mile to help his/her patients and coworkers. This position is for 2-3 days per week, depending upon candidate's preference and availability. Potential days/hours for this position are Mon 7:30-4:30, Tue 7:30-3:30, Wed 7:30-3:30, and Thurs 7:30-3:30. We have Dentrix software and Schick X-rays.
As copractitioners, our hygienists play a large role in our periodontal treatment planning and in our patient education.

SALARY IS BASED ON EXPERIENCE

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

Hygienist
We are a busy professional dental office with an immediate opening for a dental hygienist.
Primary Job Duties Include:
Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized
Instruct and educate patients in oral hygiene, provide preventative dental care, take x-rays, or apply fluoride or sealants

Great Benefits and 401K.

Ohio Hygiene License Required.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

At Eagle Family Dental our entire team is passionate about one simple, unified mission: To provide exceptional dental care to our patients while making a positive impact within our community.
Focusing on these two goals allows us to make a difference in our patient's lives. We pledge to continue our dedication to our amazing patients and to the community that we are so fortunate to call home.
Located just 40 miles north of Seattle,” Arlington has activities for people of all ages from recreation to fine dining. You can find most everything you need, with several grocery stores, a retail shopping hub at Smokey Point, a farmers’ market, and charming downtown stores. If you are craving a night out on the town, Everett is just minutes away and Arlington is halfway between Seattle and Vancouver, B.C. If it’s outdoor activities you desire World Class hiking trails, amazing golf, Centennial Trail, Stillaguamish river, local lakes, the Cascades, and Puget Sound are right at your doorstep.

Hygienist
We are a busy professional dental office with an immediate opening for a dental hygienist.
Primary Job Duties Include:
Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized
Instruct and educate patients in oral hygiene, provide preventative dental care, take x-rays, or apply fluoride or sealants

We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

Job Description:
We are excited to be hiring a Dental Hygienist to join our growing dental team. This is an amazing position with competitive pay, medical insurance, and a 401K retirement plan. We are looking for an enthusiastic, ambitious, self motivated, willing to learn, team-oriented professional who loves dentistry and is passionate about helping patients find financial solutions to care for their oral health and understand the importance of getting in to avoid larger issues. Our priority is to provide the best dental experience for each and every patient. If you are looking for an office that invests in you while providing clinical excellence in a fun office with an excellent team and patients with an added opportunity to work with a friendly dog greeter, this is your place Please send your resume We would love to hear from you.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

patient screening procedures; such as assessment of oral health conditions, review of the health history, oral cancer screening, head and neck inspection, dental charting and taking blood pressure and pulse
taking dental radiographs (x-rays)
removing calculus and plaque (hard and soft deposits) from all surfaces of the teeth
applying preventive materials to the teeth (e.g., sealants and fluorides)
teaching patients appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health;
(e.g., tooth brushing, flossing)
performing documentation and imputing computerized charting activities
Administering nitrous oxide and local anesthetic

At Eagle Family Dental our entire team is passionate about one simple, unified mission: To provide exceptional dental care to our patients while making a positive impact within our community.

Located just 40 miles north of Seattle,” Arlington has activities for people of all ages from recreation to fine dining. You can find most everything you need, with several grocery stores, a retail shopping hub at Smokey Point, a farmers’ market, and charming downtown stores. If it’s outdoor activities you desire World Class hiking trails, amazing golf, Centennial Trail, Stillaguamish river, local lakes, the Cascades, and Puget Sound are right at your doorstep.

Provides prophylaxis for patients in order to prevent serious dental health issues and disease. We are looking to hire a hygienist to do Assisted Hygiene.
For those not familiar with assisted hygiene, your job is to scale and polish the patients teeth while chatting with them and making them feel comfortable and discussing OHI as well as probing when due.
The assistant who will be assigned to you will clean and setup your room, write your notes, be available for probings. Wait for the doctor exam, treatment plan and take notes with doctor exam, clean your instruments, apply fluoride, take x-ray schedule your patients.
This is hard work (it's exactly how the dentists work) but comes with higher pay as you are able to see a higher volume of patients.
We are looking for full or part time and will be happy to do a working interview if you would like to try out this process and see what you think.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

patient screening procedures; such as assessment of oral health conditions, review of the health history, oral cancer screening, head and neck inspection, dental charting and taking blood pressure and pulse
taking dental radiographs (x-rays)
removing calculus and plaque (hard and soft deposits) from all surfaces of the teeth
applying preventive materials to the teeth (e.g., sealants and fluorides)
teaching patients appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health;
(e.g., tooth brushing, flossing)
performing documentation and imputing computerized charting activities
Administering nitrous oxide and local anesthetic

Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized
Instruct and educate patients in oral hygiene, provide preventative dental care, take x-rays, or apply fluoride or sealants

Our family practice has been around for 33 years providing comfort and care to the patients of Knox and Morrow counties. Located in rural Fredericktown OH, our team is committed to excellence in both dentistry and patient care. We believe it is important to establish a relationship with each patient built on kindness, respect and trust.?
We are looking for Dental Hygienists to help treat patients and promote good oral health practices.?
Job duties include and not limited to conducting initial patient screenings, cleaning teeth and advising patients on oral health and preventative care. You?ll help decide treatments for teeth or gum diseases . You should be reliable and able to build trust with patients of all ages. You should have knowledge of relevant health and safety rules and a good eye for oral diseases and anomalies.

patient screening procedures; such as assessment of oral health conditions, review of the health history, oral cancer screening, head and neck inspection, dental charting and taking blood pressure and pulse

applying preventive materials to the teeth (e.g., sealants and fluorides)
teaching patients appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health;
(e.g., tooth brushing, flossing)
performing documentation and imputing computerized charting activities
Administering nitrous oxide and local anesthetic

Job Title: Registered Dental Hygienist - full-time ~ $7,000.00 Sign-on Bonus
Job Description:
We are adding a Full-Time Registered Dental Hygienist to our fabulous hygiene team 4 days/week, Monday through Thursday OR Tuesday through Friday! As a Registered Dental Hygienist with Lone Tree Modern Dental & Orthodontics, you’ll be part of a team that delivers outstanding customer service and patient-focused care. Who Are We?
We are Jefferson Dental & Orthodontics and we believe in taking a personal approach to dentistry. Since our humble beginnings in Texas in 1967, we’ve been a trusted friend for our patients near and far. At Jefferson, we understand it takes more than clinical excellence to earn a patient’s trust. It’s of the utmost importance that we all see the patient as a unique individual and demonstrate that their care plan is designed around each of their needs. We’ll do whatever it takes to put a smile on each patient’s face, so the rest of the world can see how amazing it is. We truly change people’s lives. Do you want to be a part of our life changing team?!
Our philosophy is simple: Our Care Changes People’s Lives. We treat our patients like family to provide the best dental experience because we know a happy, confident smile leads to a better life. We deliver the highest quality care, making dentistry convenient and affordable for everyone. Join our new Hygiene team for the opportunity to have a fulfilling career giving our patients the happy, confident smile they deserve.

We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

Job Title: Dental Hygienist - Full Time up to 10 K Signing Bonus!
Job Description:
Overview:
A once in a life-time amazing opportunity for Dental Hygienists

At 42 North Dental we understand that Dental Hygienists are one of the strong pillars of clinical dentistry and to show you our appreciation we are proposing you the same offer as our dentists.
Responsibilities:
In our busy dental offices, you will be working very closely with the team in performing oral examination, administer oral prophylaxis, fluoride treatment, and sealants. A major part of your role will be to educate patients regarding oral hygiene and nutrition counseling. You will also be instructing and demonstrating to your patients proper brushing and flossing technique, plaque control methods, and encouraging them to adapt to better nutritional habits.
Qualifications:
A license to practice as dental hygienist in the state practicing in.

Hygienist
We are a busy professional dental office with an immediate opening for a dental hygienist.
Primary Job Duties Include:
Remove hard and soft deposits from teeth and examine oral areas, head, and neck for signs of oral disease.
Take and record dental histories, patient records and document areas of failure, both periodontally and restoratively to facilitate the dentist’s diagnosis and treatment recommendations.
Responsible for patient flow, keeping treatment rooms neat and organized
Instruct and educate patients in oral hygiene, provide preventative dental care, take x-rays, or apply fluoride or sealants

We are Jefferson Dental & Orthodontics and we believe in taking a personal approach to dentistry. Who Are We?
We are Jefferson Dental & Orthodontics and we believe in taking a personal approach to dentistry. Since our humble beginnings in Texas in 1967, we’ve been a trusted friend for our patients near and far. At Jefferson, we understand it takes more than clinical excellence to earn a patient’s trust. It’s of the utmost importance that we all see the patient as a unique individual and demonstrate that their care plan is designed around each of their needs. We’ll do whatever it takes to put a smile on each patient’s face, so the rest of the world can see how amazing it is. We truly change people’s lives. Do you want to be a part of our life changing team?!
Our philosophy is simple: Our Care Changes People’s Lives. We treat our patients like family to provide the best dental experience because we know a happy, confident smile leads to a better life. We deliver the highest quality care, making dentistry convenient and affordable for everyone. Join our new Hygiene team for the opportunity to have a fulfilling career giving our patients the happy, confident smile they deserve.

Job Title: Registered Dental Hygienist PT/FT or Temp
Job Description:
Great Respect, Benefits & Bonuses!

Our family practice has been around for 33 years providing comfort and care to the patients of Knox and Morrow counties. Located in rural Fredericktown OH, our team is committed to excellence in both dentistry and patient care. We believe it is important to establish a relationship with each patient built on kindness, respect and trust.?
We are looking for Dental Hygienists to help treat patients and promote good oral health practices.?
Job duties include and not limited to conducting initial patient screenings, cleaning teeth and advising patients on oral health and preventative care. You?ll help decide treatments for teeth or gum diseases . You should be reliable and able to build trust with patients of all ages. You should have knowledge of relevant health and safety rules and a good eye for oral diseases and anomalies.

Practice Description:We are a fun family friendly general practice in Bellevue. Long term loyal patient base. Low stress work environment. All staff members are team players. We are in need of an additional hygienist to support our growing practice. New equipment.COVID-19 considerations: Since we have returned to work in May 2020, we have implemented a wide range of safeguards to protect patients and staff members. Some of these include: NIOSH N95 masks, face shields, Surgically Clean Air units in each operatory, pre-treatment rinse.
Job Description:We are seeking a talented Hygienist to join our fun, family-friendly office 4 days per week. Hours would be 7:30-4:30, Monday-Thursday.
Long-standing office with very loyal patient base and high quality of care. One hour is allotted per patient for re-care visits. New equipment.
At least 2 years of hygiene experience is preferred, but new graduates are welcome to apply. All applicants must be gentle yet thorough.

Job Title: Dental Hygienist - Relocate to Petersburg, AK - Sign on & Relocation Bonus
Job Description:
SEARHC is a non-profit health consortium which serves the health interests of the residents of Southeast Alaska. We see our employees as our strongest assets. It is our priority to further their development and our organization by aiding in their professional advancement.
Working at SEARHC is more than a job, it’s a fulfilling career.
We offer generous benefits including:
Relocation Benefits
Retirement
Paid time off,
Paid parental leave,

Who Are We?
We are Jefferson Dental & Orthodontics and we believe in taking a personal approach to dentistry. Since our humble beginnings in Texas in 1967, we’ve been a trusted friend for our patients near and far. At Jefferson, we understand it takes more than clinical excellence to earn a patient’s trust. It’s of the utmost importance that we all see the patient as a unique individual and demonstrate that their care plan is designed around each of their needs. We’ll do whatever it takes to put a smile on each patient’s face, so the rest of the world can see how amazing it is. We truly change people’s lives. Do you want to be a part of our life changing team?!
Our philosophy is simple: Our Care Changes People’s Lives. We treat our patients like family to provide the best dental experience because we know a happy, confident smile leads to a better life. We deliver the highest quality care, making dentistry convenient and affordable for everyone. Join our new Hygiene team for the opportunity to have a fulfilling career giving our patients the happy, confident smile they deserve.
The Dental Assistant works under the supervision of the Lead RDA and are responsible for a wide range of tasks in the dental office - ranging from patient care and education to administrative duties to laboratory functions. Note: All employees need to be flexible and available to provide dental assistance and perform front desk duties based on the patient needs and as directed by office management.

Our State-of-the-art dental office is seeking an additional full-time Hygienist to assist our Team in providing excellent care for our patients. See only one patient per hour, with an emphasis on quality versus quantity of care. Our Team works as a cohesive unit, providing assistance for each other as needed. All of our Hygiene treatment rooms are equipped with extra-oral suction devices, ultrasonic scalers, intra-oral cameras, and all digital x-rays. We offer qualified medical benefits, profit sharing plan, PTO (flexible vacation and sick leave), and the amenities of a modern dental practice .??
A valid Dental Hygiene certification from the state board of dentistry.
Excellent interpersonal skills and a positive demeanor when engaging with patients.
Our schedule rotates for 3-day weekends every other week with two Saturdays per month. Our alternating schedule is M, T, W, Th 8AM-5PM and M, T, W, F 8AM-5PM, Sat 8AM-1PM.??
We look forward to making you a valued member of our Team!

* Competitive pay based on experience with bonus potential
* Medical

Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $400.00 - $600.00 per day
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Supplemental Pay:

We are a family practice that serves a diverse community with respect and dignity. Our mission is to provide quality healthcare in a safe, healthy environment for everyone. We are looking to add a hygienist to our team in a part time capacity 1-2 days. Days are negotiable, Friday preferred.
CDC, ADA, CDHA guidance determines our COVID-19 protocols. All patients pre- screened daily upon arrival. Individual operatories with doors, and open windows. COVID-19 equipment includes extra-oral evacuation system, and air purifiers.
Hygiene is the foundation of our practice. We pride ourselves on the quality and care and education we share with our patients. If you are interested in becoming part of a team that is committed to quality skills, improving access to care, and making a difference, please contact us.
Job Type: Part-time

We are looking to hire a hygienist to do Assisted Hygiene.
For those not familiar with assisted hygiene, your job is to scale and polish the patients teeth while chatting with them and making them feel comfortable and discussing OHI as well as probing when due.
The assistant who will be assigned to you will clean and setup your room, write your notes, be available for probings. Wait for the doctor exam, treatment plan and take notes with doctor exam, clean your instruments, apply fluoride, take x-ray schedule your patients.
This is hard work (it's exactly how the dentists work) but comes with higher pay as you are able to see a higher volume of patients.
We are looking for full or part time and will be happy to do a working interview if you would like to try out this process and see what you think.

patient screening procedures; such as assessment of oral health conditions, review of the health history, oral cancer screening, head and neck inspection, dental charting and taking blood pressure and pulse
taking dental radiographs (x-rays)
removing calculus and plaque (hard and soft deposits) from all surfaces of the teeth
applying preventive materials to the teeth (e.g., sealants and fluorides)
teaching patients appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health;
(e.g., tooth brushing, flossing)
performing documentation and imputing computerized charting activities
Administering nitrous oxide and local anesthetic

Job Title: Dental Hygienist with a team approach
Job Description:
EXCELLENT PAY AND BENEFITS: MEDICAL, 401K, VACATION, HOLIDAY, PTO.
LET'S MAKE A MATCH!
2 General DDS
and a board certified periodontist plus a surgeon.
Lots of opportunity to learn.
We have other hygiene on board as well.
8 operatories -- you always will have a full-loaded op with Cavitron, new hand instruments and someone to chart your perio probing. We have a sterilization tech as well!

We are looking for a caring, enthusiastic dental hygienist to join our team! We seek someone who is professional, knowledgeable, organized, and ready to hit the ground running in our busy office. Minimum 1 year experience preferred.
Part-time: Monday 3-7pm, Wednesday 3-7pm, Thursday 3-7pm, Saturday 8am-4pm, Sunday 8am-4pm. Work one day or five days per week, you choose!
Hourly Pay: $120 per hour
You will work with a dedicated assistant doing assisted hygiene. Hygiene appts are one (1) hour and you & the assistant see two (2) patients per hour.
There are opportunities for turning this into a full-time position.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

We are a small, women-led boutique practice in the Wedgwood area of Seattle. We are looking for a Dental Hygienist assistant to come onto our team and help take our practice to a whole new level.
We would love someone who is passionate about patient care, education, new technology and professional development. Here at Smiles on 35th, we believe in the power of creativity, innovation and leadership. You will have the opportunity and ability to make REAL changes and learn new things.
If you are serious about your career and personal growth, apply now!
Benefits:
We strongly believe in a healthy work-life balance. We work M-TH so that you can have a to recoup!

We are growing! Searching for Part Time OR Full Time Dental Hygienists to join our team!
As a Dental Hygienist, you should be reliable and able to build trust with patients of all ages. You should have deep knowledge of relevant health and safety rules and a good eye for oral diseases and anomalies. If you have a steady hand and great bedside manner, we would like to meet you.
Responsibilities
Ensure patients feel as comfortable as possible before their examination
Assist Doctor with treatment planning and coordination
Sterilize dental instruments properly

Our fun, friendly, caring and well-established dental office is looking for a Registered Dental hygienist. This position is available for one day to four days per week depending on your availability. Our office hours are Monday-Thursday 8:30 - 5:30 with lunch 12:30 - 1:30.
- Eaglesoft experience is a plus!
- Professional appearance and demeanor, integrity, dependability, accuracy and kindness
- Highly organized with an attention to detail
-Monthly bonuses, 401k match, Holiday Pay, Healthcare compensation, Free dental care

Job Title: Dental Hygienist with a team approach
Job Description:
EXCELLENT PAY AND BENEFITS: MEDICAL, 401K, VACATION, HOLIDAY, PTO.
LET'S MAKE A MATCH!
2 General DDS
and a board certified periodontist plus a surgeon.
Lots of opportunity to learn.
We have other hygiene on board as well.
8 operatories -- you always will have a full-loaded op with Cavitron, new hand instruments and someone to chart your perio probing. We have a sterilization tech as well!

We are looking for a caring, enthusiastic dental hygienist to join our team! We seek someone who is professional, knowledgeable, organized, and ready to hit the ground running in our busy office. Minimum 1 year experience preferred.
Part-time: Monday 3-7pm, Wednesday 3-7pm, Thursday 3-7pm, Saturday 8am-4pm, Sunday 8am-4pm. Work one day or five days per week, you choose!
Hourly Pay: $120 per hour
You will work with a dedicated assistant doing assisted hygiene. Hygiene appts are one (1) hour and you & the assistant see two (2) patients per hour.
There are opportunities for turning this into a full-time position.

We are looking for a Temporary Dental Hygienist to provide hygiene care to our valued patients during our current hygienist's maternity leave from November, 2021 thru February, 2022. This is a golden opportunity to get established in a high-quality practice with the potential for more permanency in the future. We are hoping to find someone who is interested in developing relationships with our patients and with our team. We are looking for a team player, good listener, and someone who has empathy in their work. We are interested in finding someone who enjoys learning, using their mind, and looks forward to being a thoughtful contributor to our team.
We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We take time with our patients, deeply care about their health beyond their mouth, and work to educate them to take care of themselves. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.

We are a small, women-led boutique practice in the Wedgwood area of Seattle. We are looking for a Dental Hygienist assistant to come onto our team and help take our practice to a whole new level.
We would love someone who is passionate about patient care, education, new technology and professional development. Here at Smiles on 35th, we believe in the power of creativity, innovation and leadership. You will have the opportunity and ability to make REAL changes and learn new things.
If you are serious about your career and personal growth, apply now!
Benefits:
We strongly believe in a healthy work-life balance. We work M-TH so that you can have a to recoup!

Job Title: Part Time/Full Time Registered Dental Hygienist posiiton
Job Description:
Part-Time/Full Time Registered Dental Hygienist position
Our well established and highly recommended Periodontal office in Cupertino is looking for a Part Time, to potential Full Time RDH. Our goal is to educate and help our patients understand what periodontal disease is and how they can help prevent it from progressing. The Hygienist plays a huge role in educating and creating a positive bond with the patients. We have an amazing team in the front and back who communicate often, making daily duties easy to accomplish. We want to create a working environment that is positive and productive. To help create that, we like to take trips or plan events outside of work that play as a "team building" exercise. If you have a steady hand and great bedside manner, we’d like to meet you! We offer competitive compensation as well as great benefits.
What is periodontal disease?

Job Title: Dental Hygienist - Full Time up to 10 K Signing Bonus!
Job Description:
Overview:
A once in a life-time amazing opportunity for Dental Hygienists

At 42 North Dental we understand that Dental Hygienists are one of the strong pillars of clinical dentistry and to show you our appreciation we are proposing you the same offer as our dentists.
Responsibilities:
In our busy dental offices, you will be working very closely with the team in performing oral examination, administer oral prophylaxis, fluoride treatment, and sealants. A major part of your role will be to educate patients regarding oral hygiene and nutrition counseling. You will also be instructing and demonstrating to your patients proper brushing and flossing technique, plaque control methods, and encouraging them to adapt to better nutritional habits.
Qualifications:
A license to practice as dental hygienist in the state practicing in.

We offer a competitive salary, paid Vacation & sick time, 401k as well as CE classes offered in office. Please contact us if you are interested in joining our team. We look forward to meeting you!

Pay: From $57.00 per hour
Benefits:

We have an enthusiastic team, a wonderful patient population, and sincere dentists dedicated to quality care.
Previous experience is preferred but a great attitude, and strong work ethic with integrity are our priorities so we are willing to consider new grads. Ma RDH license required.
If you are self motivated, open to feedback, and looking to provide the best quality care on the South Shore please apply today and learn more!

New equipment.COVID-19 considerations: Since we have returned to work in May 2020, we have implemented a wide range of safeguards to protect patients and staff members. Some of these include: NIOSH N95 masks, face shields, Surgically Clean Air units in each operatory, pre-treatment rinse.
Job Description:We are seeking a talented Hygienist to join our fun, family-friendly office 4 days per week. Hours would be 7:30-4:30, Monday-Thursday.
Long-standing office with very loyal patient base and high quality of care. One hour is allotted per patient for re-care visits. New equipment.
At least 2 years of hygiene experience is preferred, but new graduates are welcome to apply. All applicants must be gentle yet thorough.

Job Title: Dental Hygienist - Relocate to Petersburg, AK - Sign on & Relocation Bonus
Job Description:
SEARHC is a non-profit health consortium which serves the health interests of the residents of Southeast Alaska. We see our employees as our strongest assets. It is our priority to further their development and our organization by aiding in their professional advancement.
Working at SEARHC is more than a job, it’s a fulfilling career.
We offer generous benefits including:
Relocation Benefits
Retirement
Paid time off,
Paid parental leave,

Who Are We?
We are Jefferson Dental & Orthodontics and we believe in taking a personal approach to dentistry. Since our humble beginnings in Texas in 1967, we’ve been a trusted friend for our patients near and far. At Jefferson, we understand it takes more than clinical excellence to earn a patient’s trust. It’s of the utmost importance that we all see the patient as a unique individual and demonstrate that their care plan is designed around each of their needs. We’ll do whatever it takes to put a smile on each patient’s face, so the rest of the world can see how amazing it is. We truly change people’s lives. Do you want to be a part of our life changing team?!
Our philosophy is simple: Our Care Changes People’s Lives. We treat our patients like family to provide the best dental experience because we know a happy, confident smile leads to a better life. We deliver the highest quality care, making dentistry convenient and affordable for everyone. Join our new Hygiene team for the opportunity to have a fulfilling career giving our patients the happy, confident smile they deserve.
The Dental Assistant works under the supervision of the Lead RDA and are responsible for a wide range of tasks in the dental office - ranging from patient care and education to administrative duties to laboratory functions. Note: All employees need to be flexible and available to provide dental assistance and perform front desk duties based on the patient needs and as directed by office management.

Our State-of-the-art dental office is seeking an additional full-time Hygienist to assist our Team in providing excellent care for our patients. See only one patient per hour, with an emphasis on quality versus quantity of care. Our Team works as a cohesive unit, providing assistance for each other as needed. All of our Hygiene treatment rooms are equipped with extra-oral suction devices, ultrasonic scalers, intra-oral cameras, and all digital x-rays. We offer qualified medical benefits, profit sharing plan, PTO (flexible vacation and sick leave), and the amenities of a modern dental practice .??
A valid Dental Hygiene certification from the state board of dentistry.
Excellent interpersonal skills and a positive demeanor when engaging with patients.
Our schedule rotates for 3-day weekends every other week with two Saturdays per month. Our alternating schedule is M, T, W, Th 8AM-5PM and M, T, W, F 8AM-5PM, Sat 8AM-1PM.??
We look forward to making you a valued member of our Team!

Competitive Pay: $50 to 58/hr

If you would like to join our amazing team, please email your resume today! Feel free to visit our website www.YourNapaDentist.com to learn more about us.

Busy Private Practice looking for a talented Hygienist to treat our amazing patients at Bliss Dentistry. Our patients are largely FFS and appreciate our commitment to superb care. Each patient block is one hour and you will not be rushed. We look forward to reviewing your CV.
Thank you!
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $400.00 - $600.00 per day

8 hour shift
Supplemental Pay:

We are a family practice that serves a diverse community with respect and dignity. Our mission is to provide quality healthcare in a safe, healthy environment for everyone. We are looking to add a hygienist to our team in a part time capacity 1-2 days. Days are negotiable, Friday preferred.
CDC, ADA, CDHA guidance determines our COVID-19 protocols. All patients pre- screened daily upon arrival. Individual operatories with doors, and open windows. COVID-19 equipment includes extra-oral evacuation system, and air purifiers.
Hygiene is the foundation of our practice. We pride ourselves on the quality and care and education we share with our patients. If you are interested in becoming part of a team that is committed to quality skills, improving access to care, and making a difference, please contact us.
Job Type: Part-time

We are looking to hire a hygienist to do Assisted Hygiene.
For those not familiar with assisted hygiene, your job is to scale and polish the patients teeth while chatting with them and making them feel comfortable and discussing OHI as well as probing when due.
The assistant who will be assigned to you will clean and setup your room, write your notes, be available for probings. Wait for the doctor exam, treatment plan and take notes with doctor exam, clean your instruments, apply fluoride, take x-ray schedule your patients.
This is hard work (it's exactly how the dentists work) but comes with higher pay as you are able to see a higher volume of patients.
We are looking for full or part time and will be happy to do a working interview if you would like to try out this process and see what you think.

patient screening procedures; such as assessment of oral health conditions, review of the health history, oral cancer screening, head and neck inspection, dental charting and taking blood pressure and pulse
taking dental radiographs (x-rays)
removing calculus and plaque (hard and soft deposits) from all surfaces of the teeth
applying preventive materials to the teeth (e.g., sealants and fluorides)
teaching patients appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health;
(e.g., tooth brushing, flossing)
performing documentation and imputing computerized charting activities
Administering nitrous oxide and local anesthetic

Job Type: Part-time

We are looking to hire a hygienist to do Assisted Hygiene.
For those not familiar with assisted hygiene, your job is to scale and polish the patients teeth while chatting with them and making them feel comfortable and discussing OHI as well as probing when due.
The assistant who will be assigned to you will clean and setup your room, write your notes, be available for probings. Wait for the doctor exam, treatment plan and take notes with doctor exam, clean your instruments, apply fluoride, take x-ray schedule your patients.
This is hard work (it's exactly how the dentists work) but comes with higher pay as you are able to see a higher volume of patients.
We are looking for full or part time and will be happy to do a working interview if you would like to try out this process and see what you think.

patient screening procedures; such as assessment of oral health conditions, review of the health history, oral cancer screening, head and neck inspection, dental charting and taking blood pressure and pulse
taking dental radiographs (x-rays)
removing calculus and plaque (hard and soft deposits) from all surfaces of the teeth
applying preventive materials to the teeth (e.g., sealants and fluorides)
teaching patients appropriate oral hygiene strategies to maintain oral health;
(e.g., tooth brushing, flossing)
performing documentation and imputing computerized charting activities
Administering nitrous oxide and local anesthetic

We are a practice that has resisted the trends in dentistry of offering a little bit of care to a large population and prefer a model of offering more complete care and availing enough time to help our patients get on a healthy preventive track. We do not limit our responsibility to our patients health by what insurance dictates to us, but talk openly and honestly with patients about their oral conditions and what might improve their wellbeing.
